definition: lit. kicking up the dust and breaking the harness/fig. to ride like the wind (idiom)
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
old horse sniffs the wind (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
sage Emperors Shun and Yao rule every day (idiom); all for the best in the best of all possible worlds
lit. the eye cannot bear to see it (idiom); a scene too pitiful to behold
sacrificing one's life generously (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
starving people everywhere (idiom); a state of famine
magnificent building reduced to a mound of rubble (idiom); fig. all one's plans in ruins
to sleep on one's armor with a spear as a pillow (idiom)/to keep ready for battle at all times
